citeinfo.origin:
Committee on the Bering Sea Ecosystem
Polar Research Board
Commission on Geosciences, Environment, and Resources
National Research Council, National Academy of Sciences
citeinfo.title: The Bering Sea Ecosystem

abstract.p: The Bering Sea is a subarctic, semi-closed northern extension of the North Pacific Ocean, Itï¾’s southern boundary is marked by the Aleutian Islands and its northern boundary by Bering Strait. The plentiful fish and game of the Bering Sea have supported the lives and livelihood of people on both the Asian and the North American continents since prehistoric times. Recent declines and fish and game populations have raised concerns about how living resources in the area have been and should be managed.
[Reference: National Research Council, Committee on the Bering Sea Ecosystem. 1996. The Bering Sea Ecosystem. National Academy Press. Washington, D.C.307 pp]
This volume may be found at many university libraries.

descript.purpose: To study the available scientific and technical information on the Bering Sea ecosystem, focusing on environmental factors that influence natural variability in populations.
